intro: Mimosa manzanilloana, commonly known as the Mexican mimosa, is a shrub native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features compound leaves that are sensitive to touch, causing them to fold shut—a response known as thigmonastic movement. Its small, yellow flowers are followed by fluffy, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. Mimosa manzanilloana is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
